CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority

TYPE_AND_ACTIVITIES.TYPE_OF_ACTIVITY_OTHER: Prison Service & made available to Other Government Departments

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: The supply of new physical training equipment.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Fitness equipments. Treadmills. Cross trainers. Rowing machines. Weight and resistance training equipment. Weight benches or racks. Fitness weights. Multi gyms. Dumbbells. Exercise balls. The Authority is seeking expressions of interest from suitably experienced/qualified companies who wish to be included in the competition for the following requirement:
The requirement/contract is for the supply and installation of New Physical Training (PT) Equipment which includes but not limited to the following:
a. electrical and self powered cardio vascular equipment – treadmills, spinning bikes, cross trainers, rowing machines etc.;
b. multi-station, single station and ancillary weight training equipment suitable for general resistance training;
c. accessories including powerbags, medicine balls, wall charts, heart monitors;
d. from time to time there will be a requirement for "1 off" purchases for specialist PT equipment.
This will be a mutli supplier framework arrangement, meaning more than one supplier may offer the same or similar products.
The future contracts will be direct supply to end users any where within the UK.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: All numbers provided below are for a guide only and without commintment. The requirement is for a range of Cardio Vascular (CV) Free Weights and Resistance Physical Training Equipment, and covers over 30 types of equipment. As a guide only, the following is an example of PT equipment bought by the MOD during 2010 including quantities (in brackets) running machines (190), cross trainers (140), rowing machines (350), spinning bikes (300), powerbags (3 000) medicine balls, (1 000) heart monitors (350).
All CV Equipment and Resistance equipment must be supported with a 2 year warranty and a 1 x service at the end of year 1 to be included within the price of the equipment.

The Framework arrangements will also be offered to other government departments to procure their PT equipment. These departments include the Ministry of Justice, the Fire Service and the Police and Health service. There is no guarantee however that these departments will use these contracts.

The Framework arrangements will be direct supply contracts, and currently the MOD has over 500 UK end users who procure PT equipment from the current contracts, and equipment is delivered directly to the end user.
If other government departments use the future Framework arrangements then the number of end users ordering from these contracts will increase.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: The framework arrangement will be a for a 2 year duration with 1 x 2 year extension option.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: Parent Company or Banker's Guarantee may be required.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: MOD - BACS (payment within 30 days of order receipt) P2P. This may be different for other government departments.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: (a) is bankrupt or is being wound up, where his affairs are being administered by the court, where he has entered into an arrangement with creditors, where he has suspended business activities or is in any analogous situation arising from a similar procedure under national laws and regulations;

(b) is the subject of proceedings for a declaration of bankruptcy, for an order for compulsory winding up or administration by the court or of an arrangement with creditors or of any other similar proceedings under national laws and regulations;
(c) has been convicted by a judgement which has he force of res judicata in accordance with the legal provisions of the country of any offence concerning his professional conduct;
(d) has been guilty of grave professional misconduct proven by ay means which the contracting authorities can demonstrate;

(f) has not fulfilled obligations relating to the payment of taxes in accordance with the legal provisions of the country in which he is established or with those of the country of the contracting authority;
(g) is guilty of serious misrepresentation in supplying the information required under this section or has not supplied such information;
(h) has been the subject of a conviction for participation in a criminal organisation as defined in Article 2(1) of Council Joint Action 98/733/JHA;
(j) has been the subject of a conviction for fraud within the meaning of Article 1 of the Convention relating to the protection of the financial interests of the European Communities;

(k) has been the subject of a conviction for money laundering, as defined in Article 1 of Council Directive 91/308/EEC of 10 June 1991 on prevention of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money laundering.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: (c) a statement of the undertaking's overall turnover and, where appropriate, of turnover in the area covered by the contract for a maximum of the last 3 financial years available, depending on the date on which the undertaking was set up or the economic operator started trading, as far as the information on these turnovers is available.
Potential suppliers who submit an expression of interest (EOI) will be required to complete a pre qualification questionnaire (PQQ) that will address sections 111.2.1 - 111.2.3.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: (d) A description of the technical facilities and measures used by the supplier or service provider for ensuring quality and the undertaking's study and research facilities

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: To be entered into this competition an written/emailed expression of interest is required within 37 calendar days. Once the 37 days has ended you will be issued with the Pre Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ) This PQQ will assess the following:
(Please note that the PQQ is in 2 parts - Part 1 will not be scored, Part 2 will contain the criteria with which the companies will be scored).
3. Satisfactory completion of "Certificate of Good Standing" (Pass/Fail).
5. A willingness to participate in a Reverse Auction (Pass/Fail).
A Fail against any (Pass/Fail) question will result in non-compliance and removal from the competition.
Non Pass/Fail questions will be marked and scored:

An overall score of 60 % or higher will be required for the non Pass/Fail questions to be considered to be taken forward to Invitation to Tender (ITT) stage, and should more than 6 companies meet 60 % then only the top 6 will be given the opportunity to be taken forward to ITT stage.
The ITT will assess (as a minimum) the following scored questions:

Technical specification (compliance) of equipment - Bidders will be required to meet an overall technical compliance of a minimum of 90 % against MOD technical specifications (MOD technical specifications to be provided to bidders at ITT stage) Bidders will be unable to bid for items for which they were non compliant should they meet the overall 90 %. If bidders fail to meet an overall technical compliance of 90 % against the required equipment range then they will not be taken forward to Reverse Auction.
The scoring for the ITT will be as follows: A Fail against any (Pass/Fail) question will result in non-compliance and removal from the competition.
Non Pass/Fail questions will be marked and scored as follows:

A minimum score of 70 % on scored questions and a minimum 90 % compliance against technical specifications is required at ITT stage in order to proceed to the reverse auction. Further specific detail about the reverse auction process will be provided at ITT stage.

USE_ELECTRONIC_AUCTION.P: Yes. A Reverse Auction, conducted using electronic means, may be used as part of the procurement process for this requirement. Specific relevant information on Reverse Auction usage will be given in the Invitation to Tender.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: Suppliers interested in working with the Ministry of Defence should register on the MOD Supplier Information Database (SID) Register, available at www.contracts.mod.uk. The MOD SID is a database of active and potential suppliers available to all MOD and UK Defence procurement personnel, and is the main supplier database of MOD Procurement organisations. Please note: the registration and publication of a company profile on the MOD SID does not mean or imply that the supplier has in any way been vetted or approved by the MOD. Suppliers wishing to compete for advertised MOD contracts must respond to any specific call for competition by submitting a separate expression of interest in accordance with the instructions of the purchasing organisation.

Advertising Regime OJEU: These contract opportunities are published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU) and the MOD Defence Contracts Bulletin. The award of any subsequent contract arising from such requirements is subject to the Public Contract Regulations 2006. Where advertising is necessary in the OJEU and the DCB, the content of the two adverts must be exactly the same.
Responses can only be accepted in the following formats:- MS Office (97-2003) & Adobe (PDF) Tracker Reference: TKR-2011120-DCB-2132585 GO Reference: GO-2011120-DCB-2132586.

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: The Authority will incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period at the point when information on the award of contract is communicated to tenderers. This period allows unsuccessful tenderers the opportunity to seek clarification and/or further debriefing from the contracting authority before the contract is entered into. Such debriefs should be requested from the officer named in this contract notice or in the letter/email providing information about the contract award.
